findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The smart contract allows unprotected Ether withdrawal.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function allows a spender to withdraw a set number of tokens from a specified account without proper protection.

findings.title: Unprotected permit function
findings.description: The permit function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function is not protected, allowing unauthorized access and potential exploitation.

findings.title: Unprotected burn function
findings.description: The burn function can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Unprotected swap function
findings.description: The swap function is unprotected and can be exploited by malicious users.

findings.title: Unprotected skim function
findings.description: The skim function is marked as external and does not have any access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The sync function is not protected against reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected, allowing anyone to call it and potentially causing unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected setMaxrToken function
findings.description: The setMaxrToken function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized changes.

findings.title: Unprotected setTeamAddress function
findings.description: The setTeamAddress function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, potentially allowing unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.

findings.title: Unprotected setDevAddress function
findings.description: The setDevAddress function is unprotected and can be called by anyone.

findings.title: Unprotected setDevFee function
findings.description: The setDevFee function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected addPool function
findings.description: The addPool function is declared as external and lacks proper access control, allowing unauthorized users to interact with it.

findings.title: Unprotected updatePool function
findings.description: The updatePool function is declared as external and lacks access control, allowing anyone to call it.

findings.title: Unprotected deposit function
findings.description: The deposit function does not have any access control or validation, allowing anyone to call it and potentially drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unprotected withdraw function
findings.description: The withdraw function does not have any access control or validation, allowing anyone to withdraw tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected claim function
findings.description: The claim function is unprotected and can be exploited by an external attacker.

findings.title: Unprotected swapAndDistribute function
findings.description: The swapAndDistribute function lacks protection, making it vulnerable to potential attacks.

findings.title: Unprotected safeRewardTransfer function
findings.description: The safeRewardTransfer function is unprotected and can be exploited.

findings.title: Unprotected renounceOwnership function
findings.description: The contract's ownership can be renounced without any protection or access control, posing a centralization risk.

findings.title: Unprotected transferOwnership function
findings.description: The transferOwnership function can be executed by the contract owner without any restrictions, posing a centralization risk.
